Description: Axe-head: with rounded blade and angular lugs containing near the rear three binding-holes drilled in a line parallel to the butt. The blade is lightly patinated, the pattern of corrosion near the butt indicating that the axe was originally hafted. Marks of the original grinding are visible on the cutting edge together with signs of slight wear.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (35)
